name: packing, cement | packing, cement | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9967/documentation

The packing and loading process is normalized with an annual production volume of 1'500'000 kg/a. The estimated lifespan of the machines is 25 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



Includes the process of packing, transportation within the plant and loading of the bags on paletts. The machines for these processes are taken into account. The waste treatment after use by the end-user and transports of the packing materials are included. Energy demand not included as it is included in the different concrete types.
category: N:Administrative and support service activities/82:Office administrative, office support and other business support activities/829:Business support service activities n.e.c./8292:Packaging activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are from one company (packing, lime products) in Switzerland, adapted for cement.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Assumption: same process as for packing of lime products
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Measured data of one Swiss plant for packing of lime products
